intro: Arachis rigonii, commonly known as the Brazilian groundnut, is a wild species of peanut native to South America. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers followed by pods containing one or two seeds. It has compound leaves with three to five leaflets and is characterized by its deep root system. Arachis rigonii is often studied for its genetic diversity and potential use in breeding programs to improve peanut varieties.
